verses.verse: And he began<WG756> again<WG3825> to teach<WG1321> by the sea<WG2281> side:<WG3844> and there was gathered<WG4863> to him a great<WG4183> multitude,<WG3793> so<WG5620> that he entered<WG1684> into<WG1519> a ship,<WG4143> and sat<WG2521> in the sea;<WG2281> and the whole<WG3956> multitude<WG3793> was by the sea<WG2281> on<WG1909> the land.<WG1095>
And he taught<WG2258> <WG1321> them many<WG4183> things by parables,<WG3850> and said<WG3004> to them in his doctrine,<WG1322>
Listen;<WG191> Behold,<WG2400> there went<WG1831> out a sower<WG4687> to sow: <WG4687>

And it came<WG1096> to pass, as he sowed,<WG4687> some <WG3588> <WG3303> fell<WG4098> by the way<WG3598> side,<WG3844> and the fowls<WG4071> of the air<WG3772> came<WG2064> and devoured<WG2719> it up.

And some<WG243> fell<WG4098> on<WG1909> stony<WG4075> ground, where<WG3699> it had<WG2192> not much<WG4183> earth;<WG1093> and immediately<WG2112> it sprang<WG1816> up, because<WG1223> it had<WG2192> no<WG3361> depth<WG899> of earth: <WG1093>
But when the sun<WG2246> was up, it was scorched;<WG2739> and because<WG1223> it had<WG2192> no<WG3361> root,<WG4491> it withered<WG3583> away.
And some<WG243> fell<WG4098> among<WG1519> thorns,<WG173> and the thorns<WG173> grew<WG305> up, and choked<WG4846> it, and it yielded<WG1325> no<WG3756> fruit. <WG2590>

And other<WG243> fell<WG4098> on<WG1519> good<WG2570> ground,<WG1093> and did yield<WG1325> fruit<WG2590> that sprang<WG305> up and increased;<WG837> and brought<WG5342> forth,<WG5342> some<WG1520> thirty,<WG5144> and some<WG1520> sixty,<WG1835> and some<WG1520> an hundred. <WG1540>
And he said<WG3004> to them, He that has<WG2192> ears<WG3775> to hear,<WG191> let him hear. <WG191>
And when<WG3753> he was alone,<WG2651> they that were about<WG4012> him with the twelve<WG1427> asked<WG2065> of him the parable.<WG3850>

And he said<WG3004> to them, To you it is given<WG1325> to know<WG1097> the mystery<WG3466> of the kingdom<WG932> of God:<WG2316> but to them that are without,<WG1854> all <WG3956> these<WG3588> things are done<WG1096> in parables: <WG3850>

That seeing<WG991> they may see,<WG991> and not perceive;<WG1492> and hearing<WG191> they may hear,<WG191> and not understand;<WG4920> lest<WG3379> at<WG3379> any<WG3379> time<WG3379> they should be converted,<WG1994> and their sins<WG265> should be forgiven<WG863> them.
And he said<WG3004> to them, Know<WG1492> you not this<WG5026> parable?<WG3850> and how<WG4459> then will you know<WG1097> all<WG3956> parables? <WG3850>
The sower<WG4687> sows<WG4687> the word. <WG3056>

And these<WG3778> are they by the way<WG3598> side,<WG3844> where<WG3699> the word<WG3056> is sown;<WG4687> but when<WG3752> they have heard,<WG191> Satan<WG4567> comes<WG2064> immediately,<WG2112> and takes<WG142> away<WG142> the word<WG3056> that was sown<WG4687> in their hearts. <WG2588>

And these<WG3778> are they likewise<WG3668> which are sown<WG4687> on<WG1909> stony<WG4075> ground; who,<WG3739> when<WG3752> they have heard<WG191> the word,<WG3056> immediately<WG2112> receive<WG2983> it with gladness; <WG5479>

And have<WG2192> no<WG3756> root<WG4491> in themselves,<WG1438> and so endure<WG2076> but for a time:<WG4340> afterward,<WG1534> when affliction<WG2347> or<WG2228> persecution<WG1375> rises<WG1096> for the word's<WG3056> sake, immediately<WG2112> they are offended. <WG4624>
And these<WG3778> are they which are sown<WG4687> among<WG1519> thorns;<WG173> such<WG3778> as hear<WG191> the word, <WG3056>

And the cares<WG3308> of this<WG3588> world,<WG165> and the deceitfulness<WG539> of riches,<WG4149> and the lusts<WG1939> of other<WG3062> things entering<WG1531> in, choke<WG4846> the word,<WG3056> and it becomes<WG1096> unfruitful. <WG175>

And these<WG3778> are they which are sown<WG4687> on<WG1909> good<WG2570> ground;<WG1093> such<WG3748> as hear<WG191> the word,<WG3056> and receive <WG3858> it, and bring<WG2592> forth<WG2592> fruit,<WG2592> some<WG1520> thirty times,<WG5144> some<WG1520> sixty,<WG1835> and some<WG1520> an hundred. <WG1540>

And he said<WG3004> to them, Is a candle<WG3088> brought<WG2064> to be put<WG5087> under<WG5259> a bushel,<WG3426> or<WG2228> under<WG5259> a bed?<WG2825> and not to be set<WG2007> on<WG1909> a candlestick? <WG3087>

For there is nothing <WG3756> <WG5100> hid,<WG2927> which<WG3739> shall not be manifested;<WG5319> neither<WG3761> was any<WG5100> thing kept<WG1096> secret,<WG614> but that it should come<WG2064> abroad. <WG1519> <WG5318>
If any<WG1536> man have<WG2192> ears<WG3775> to hear,<WG191> let him hear. <WG191>

And he said<WG3004> to them, Take heed<WG991> what you hear:<WG191> with what<WG3739> measure<WG3358> you mete,<WG3354> it shall be measured<WG3354> to you: and to you that hear<WG191> shall more<WG4369> be given. <WG4369>
For he that has,<WG2192> to him shall be given:<WG1325> and he that has<WG2192> not, from him shall be taken<WG142> even<WG2532> that which<WG3739> he has. <WG2192>
And he said,<WG3004> So<WG3779> is the kingdom<WG932> of God,<WG2316> as if<WG1487> a man<WG444> should cast<WG906> seed<WG4703> into<WG1909> the ground; <WG1093>
And should sleep,<WG2518> and rise<WG1453> night<WG3571> and day,<WG2250> and the seed<WG4703> should spring<WG985> and grow<WG3373> up, he knows<WG1492> not how. <WG5613>

For the earth<WG1093> brings<WG2592> forth<WG2592> fruit<WG2592> of herself;<WG844> first<WG4412> the blade,<WG5528> then<WG1534> the ear,<WG4719> after<WG1534> that the full<WG4134> corn<WG4621> in the ear. <WG4719>
But when the fruit<WG2590> is brought<WG3860> forth,<WG3860> immediately<WG2112> he puts<WG649> in the sickle,<WG1407> because<WG3754> the harvest<WG2326> is come. <WG3936>
And he said,<WG3004> Whereunto<WG5101> shall we liken<WG3666> the kingdom<WG932> of God?<WG2316> or<WG2228> with what<WG4169> comparison<WG3850> shall we compare<WG3846> it?

It is like<WG5613> a grain<WG2848> of mustard<WG4615> seed,<WG4690> which,<WG3739> when it is sown<WG4687> in the earth,<WG1093> is less<WG3398> than all<WG3956> the seeds<WG4690> that be in the earth: <WG1093>

But when it is sown,<WG4687> it grows<WG305> up, and becomes<WG1096> greater<WG3187> than all<WG3956> herbs,<WG3001> and shoots<WG4160> out great<WG3173> branches;<WG2798> so<WG5620> that the fowls<WG4071> of the air<WG3772> may<WG1410> lodge<WG2681> under<WG5259> the shadow<WG4639> of it.
And with many<WG4183> such<WG5108> parables<WG3850> spoke<WG2980> he the word<WG3056> to them, as they were able<WG1410> to hear<WG191> it.
But without<WG5565> a parable<WG3850> spoke,<WG2980> <WG2398> he not to them: and when they were alone,<WG2596> <WG2398> he expounded<WG1956> all<WG3956> things to his disciples.<WG3101>
And the same<WG1565> day,<WG2250> when the even<WG3798> was come,<WG1096> he said<WG3004> to them, Let us pass<WG1330> over<WG1330> to the other<WG4008> side. <WG4008>
And when they had sent<WG863> away<WG863> the multitude,<WG3793> they took<WG3880> him even as he was in the ship.<WG4143> And there were also with him other<WG243> little<WG4142> ships.<WG4142>
And there arose<WG1096> a great<WG3173> storm<WG2978> of wind,<WG417> and the waves<WG2949> beat<WG1911> into<WG1519> the ship,<WG4143> so<WG5620> that it was now<WG2235> full.<WG1072>

And he was in the hinder<WG4403> part of the ship, asleep<WG2518> on<WG1909> a pillow:<WG4344> and they awake<WG1326> him, and say<WG3004> to him, Master,<WG1320> care<WG3199> you not that we perish?<WG622>

And he arose,<WG1326> and rebuked<WG2008> the wind,<WG417> and said<WG2036> to the sea,<WG2281> Peace,<WG4623> be still. <WG5392> And the wind<WG417> ceased,<WG2869> and there was a great<WG3173> calm.<WG1055>
And he said<WG2036> to them, Why<WG5101> are you so<WG3779> fearful?<WG1169> how<WG4459> is it that you have<WG2192> no<WG3756> faith? <WG4102>

And they feared<WG5399> <WG5401> exceedingly,<WG5401> <WG3173> and said<WG3004> one<WG240> to another,<WG240> What<WG5101> <WG686> manner<WG686> of man is this,<WG3778> that even<WG2532> the wind<WG417> and the sea<WG2281> obey<WG5219> him?
